review_text: isited Semicolon Cafe recently and the place definitely has a nice vibe ‚Äî cozy ambiance and aesthetically pleasing setup. We tried the chicken sandwich, egg sandwich, and a coffee. The presentation was great; everything looked really appetizing. However, the taste didn‚Äôt quite match the visual appeal. The sandwiches were decent but could‚Äôve used a bit more flavor. Coffee was okay, not the best but not bad either. Overall, a decent spot to hang out, but there‚Äôs room for improvement on the taste side. Rating: 3.8/5.

isited Semicolon Cafe recently and the place definitely has a nice vibe ‚Äî cozy ambiance and aesthetically pleasing setup. We tried the chicken sandwich, egg sandwich, and a coffee. The presentation was great; everything looked really appetizing. However, the taste didn‚Äôt quite match the visual appeal. The sandwiches were decent but could‚Äôve used a bit more flavor. Coffee was okay, not the best but not bad either. Overall, a decent spot to hang out, but there‚Äôs room for improvement on the taste side. Rating: 3.8/5.

Came here for the first time and all I can say is WOW! I ordered the avocado sandwich and loved it.

The bread was light and fluffy and all of the ingredients inside worked together just right. Wish there was a little more sauce though (but still good). The sandwich was a little on the pricey side and kind of small for a full (it‚Äôs just right for a snack or light breakfast) meal but the quality and taste makes up for it.

The ambience is clean and calming, though there are limited seats as the cafe is quite small. However, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an issue because it doesn‚Äôt seem too crowded.

Ordering is done through a kiosk and the food comes generally quickly. As for parking, I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs much next to the cafe. I would recommend parking at the Bellevue square mall garage and then taking a short walk to the cafe, as it‚Äôs quite close.

Anyways, I will definitely be back to try more!

Anyways, I will definitely be back to try more!

Fluffy sandwich with good flavor. Just a headsup; if you‚Äôre in a hurry, you might want to skip it as the wait time can be a bit long. Also, the space is quite small compared to the crowd it draws so it can feel a little cramped during peak hours.

Fluffy sandwich with good flavor. Just a headsup; if you‚Äôre in a hurry, you might want to skip it as the wait time can be a bit long. Also, the space is quite small compared to the crowd it draws so it can feel a little cramped during peak hours.

We finally visited Semicolon Cafe‚Äîit had been getting quite a bit of hype, so I was curious to see what it was all about.

The space itself looks cute from far, and the concept seems promising, but the experience didn‚Äôt quite live up to the buzz. We arrived just a few minutes after opening on a weekend, and the staff already seemed a bit overwhelmed and confused, juggling multiple orders. Even though you order in a Tablet with no cashier interaction, it still took a while to get our coffee.
The ambience is very white, but the places is already showing the lack of cleaniless. Tables and chair chipped, looking dirty because it's all white.

Speaking of the coffee‚Äîit was just okay. Nothing memorable. Also, all the photos I had seen showed beautiful drinks in transparent cups, but ours came in basic paper cups, which was a bit of a letdown.

The sandwiches, unfortunately, were the biggest disappointment. They were kind of a mess‚Äîflavorless, overly drenched in mayo, and lacking everything.

Overall, it felt like one of those places that got popular on social media but doesn‚Äôt have much to offer beyond the aesthetic. Not terrible, just not worth the hype.

I recently discovered this cozy little cafe that has some really unique sandwiches on the menu, and let me tell you, they taste amazing! The atmosphere is super relaxed, and I can totally see myself stopping by for quick lunches in the future. It's such a delightful spot!

I recently discovered this cozy little cafe that has some really unique sandwiches on the menu, and let me tell you, they taste amazing! The atmosphere is super relaxed, and I can totally see myself stopping by for quick lunches in the future. It's such a delightful spot!

The bulgogi sandwich was quite disappointing. It didn't have much flavour, and was more like a western sandwich. The bread isn't like the typical fluffy bread you find in these Korean sandwiches, the lettuce felt out of place, and the sauce wasn't enough to save it. The portion size is avergae for these types of sandwiches, so not quite enough for a full lunch. Wouldn't come back for the sandwiches, but maybe the drinks are good!

The bulgogi sandwich was quite disappointing. It didn't have much flavour, and was more like a western sandwich. The bread isn't like the typical fluffy bread you find in these Korean sandwiches, the lettuce felt out of place, and the sauce wasn't enough to save it. The portion size is avergae for these types of sandwiches, so not quite enough for a full lunch. Wouldn't come back for the sandwiches, but maybe the drinks are good!

The is a niche small cafe with some very tasty sandwiches, coffee, and phenomenal parfaits.

The sandwiches are very delicious, and they have various offerings that are all very good.

The parfaits are unique in that they have pieces of cheesecake, as well as crunchy corn flake bits.  Not too sweet, and enough textures to really make this desert a treat.

I definitely recommend coming here if you are in the area.  You absolutely have to try the parfaits - as they are not to be missed!

Ordered 3 sandwiches: avocado delicious sauce, chicken yummy and spicy, Shroom tasty and light but somewhat bland.
All around very tasty and would definitely go again.
Sandwich size is perfect although looks big but it really isn‚Äôt.
Very light on the stomach since it‚Äôs all fresh ingredients and packed with veggies.

Ordered 3 sandwiches: avocado delicious sauce, chicken yummy and spicy, Shroom tasty and light but somewhat bland.
All around very tasty and would definitely go again.
Sandwich size is perfect although looks big but it really isn‚Äôt.
Very light on the stomach since it‚Äôs all fresh ingredients and packed with veggies.

Stopped in after a workout nearby based off an ad I saw on social media recently, and unfortunately fell into the ‚Äúlooks pretty, taste meh‚Äù category.

Nothing was wrong, everything was fine. I don‚Äôt want to spend 14$ for a ‚Äúfine‚Äù sandwich and 12$ for a ‚Äúfine‚Äù drink. I paid more for an extra shot of espresso, and it still tasted like milk. The BELT sandwich was okay, but for 14$ I do expect it to taste like more than just brioche bread. I tasted no bacon or tomatoes, the eggs were unseasoned, overall just ingredients hiding in fancy bread.

Staff were friendly and helpful, but it was all self service. If the prices drastically dropped I‚Äôd go back, but until then I‚Äôll go literally anywhere else.

The sandwiches and drinks here are really good‚ÄîI‚Äôve never had authentic Gilgeori Toast, so I can‚Äôt speak to authenticity, but I loved the flavor. The cafe has seating, so you can sit and enjoy your food, but it‚Äôs not a cozy spot to linger for long. Parking can be tricky‚Äîyou‚Äôll need to park at the mall and walk about five minutes, as street parking is limited. Overall, it‚Äôs a hit, and I‚Äôd definitely come back!

Food is good. Get the tiramisu latte, it's amazing.

Minus one star because the girl working was too busy scrolling Instagram (standing behind the counter, I could literally see her scrolling Instagram) to take my order and I ended up using the self serve kiosk.

Food is good. Get the tiramisu latte, it's amazing.

Minus one star because the girl working was too busy scrolling Instagram (standing behind the counter, I could literally see her scrolling Instagram) to take my order and I ended up using the self serve kiosk.

Went with a friend, lots of seats, very aesthetic, food came out quickly and was tasty. Friend said the bingsu ($8) was as good as the more expensive ones from another place. Overall very nice experience, you order on the tablet so it's anxiety friendly! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Hipster Asian fusion sandwich place that I had been on list to try and finally got to go.  This is definitely a place to try but would not be a go-to place if I was in the area.

Parking: Shared retail parking for the building
Pet friendly: Yes ‚Äì I would have assumed no since the caf√© is super tiny without an outdoor seating but there was a dog the day I went.
Family friendly: Yes if your child can sit on a backless stool without you worry they will fall off LOL

FOOD:
Overall: Go in knowing that there is a base for the sandwiches meaning all of them have scrambled eggs with grilled corn and lettuce in between toasted brioche bread.  This is my personal preference but I‚Äôm not a fan of brioche‚Ä¶ its fluffy but its ‚Äútoo fluffy‚Äù that there isn‚Äôt a good density that holds everything in the sandwich.  No matter what I‚Äôve had between brioche, it always always always falls apart.  The eggs did not have any taste to it‚Ä¶ like it needed just basic salt and pepper.  I also didn‚Äôt taste any corn.  If I didn‚Äôt read corn in the menu description, I wouldn‚Äôt have thought there was any.

1. S.O.S Sandwich (base, tomato, red cabbage, cheddar cheese, Kiwi sauce, mayonnaise) $9.49: 2 Stars - I know some people are adverse to mayo but I love it.  But literally all I taste is mayo.
2. Chicken Sandwich (base, spicy chicken, red onion, jalapeno, mozzarella cheese, spicy sauce) $11.49: 2 Stars - Not spicy at all and the flavor was just okay.  I love spicy and there was barely a kick.
3. Lox Sandwich (base, Arugula, smoked salmon, red onion, yogurt dill sauce) $12.49: 3 Stars - I understand the sandwich is small but I feel like they skimped on the filling.  The ratio was off ‚Äì meager amount of smoked salmon (like one slice/piece) to sauce.  All I could taste was mushy-non-corn-tasting-eggs and dill sauce.
4. Bulgogi Sandwich (base, tomato, marinated beef bulgogi, red onions, Bulgogi sauce) $11.99: 2 Stars - Bulgogi has a distinct flavor that I did not get here.  The one good thing I can say about this sandwich is there was at least a textural difference with it being a beef sandwich.

MENU/RESTAURANT:
When I walked in I actually thought this place was a walk up and order place only because of how uber small it was.  My plan was a quick sit down lunch with my family but we had to do take out as there was no way my 2 year old son could stably sit down on the modern cubes they had for most of their seating.   The loved the d√©cor inside - very clean, simple, modern, and black and white.

I like the idea of the menu - small, streamline, and focused on a few things.  What is better than a pretty sandwich? I love carbs so anything in sandwich form is great.

SERVICE:
Meh.  You order from a tablet so you don‚Äôt actually have much interaction with anyone.  I saw a few folks behind the counter but no one that made eye contact or spoke to me until they called out my number‚Ä¶ the girl just said the number, pushed out my bag, and didn‚Äôt really say anything else.

It looks prettier than it taste to eat. It's not bad, the sauces are good. But it's not a true representation gilgeori/Korean toast like you would get in Korea. It lacks the heavily buttered and fried bread and American cheese that makes the Korean native dish.

On its own it's a good egg sandwich but what it's trying to be it's not wholly accurate to the thing in Korea.

It looks prettier than it taste to eat. It's not bad, the sauces are good. But it's not a true representation gilgeori/Korean toast like you would get in Korea. It lacks the heavily buttered and fried bread and American cheese that makes the Korean native dish.

On its own it's a good egg sandwich but what it's trying to be it's not wholly accurate to the thing in Korea.

Semicolon Cafe in Bellevue is a delightful find, tucked away near the Safeway in Bellevue downtown. It‚Äôs a small spot, so it can be easy to miss while driving by. We usually park at Safeway and walk over, so I can‚Äôt comment on the availability of dedicated parking nearby.

The cafe is cozy but has limited seating, so it might be better suited for takeout during busy times. They offer a variety of options, including coffee, shaved ice, and their standout item: sandwiches. The menu leans heavily toward Asian-style sandwiches, though there are other choices as well.

My favorites are the Avocado and BELT sandwiches. The flavors are excellent, fresh, and thoughtfully crafted. However, the portions are a bit small for the price, so if you‚Äôre a big eater, consider ordering two to try different options. The coffee is decent‚Äînothing extraordinary for me as I‚Äôm not a coffee enthusiast‚Äîbut it pairs well with their food.

They also serve shaved ice, though I haven‚Äôt had a chance to try it yet.

Overall, Semicolon Cafe offers great food in a convenient location. While the prices reflect its downtown Bellevue setting, the quality and experience make it worth it. I highly recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre in the area and looking for a quick breakfast or brunch. They open at 8 AM, making it a perfect spot to grab something delicious before heading to work or during a break.

This was, singlehandedly, the BEST breakfast sandwich I have ever had. Yes, even better than most sit-down restaurants!

Semicolon feels like a place that has their customer top-of-mind. It‚Äôs a welcoming, well-decorated space that has clear pictures and pricing for their food and drinks, and even offers both wifi and parking recommendations with their own promo code! The space is set up very well for handling queues and giving folks space to sit and chat. Their drink and food options looked both tasty and pretty, and I appreciated the variety of flavor options they offer!
I did not try their drinks, but I was happy to see they offered different degrees of sweetness and caffeine for their lattes and espresso drinks. Whether you love a strong espresso flavor or ‚Äúdessert in a cup‚Äù sweetness, this place has you covered! There‚Äôs also a small fridge that includes some canned drink options, along with some other sweet dessert/food options.

I ordered via a single machine at the front, which gives you a clear picture of the menu options and provides a HUGE level of customization! (Side note: if you get anxious about talking to folks when ordering, this place is a great option for you!) I ended up doing an add-on of bacon to my avocado sandwich, and saw a ton of different options for other ways to customize. I noticed a number of orders packaged up and waiting, so it looks like you also have the option to order ahead or order through a meal delivery app for this place!
Wait time was very minimal‚Äîit took about 5 minutes between me placing my order and hearing my number called out.

The sandwich here felt like everything I‚Äôd ever want and more! The brioche bread is crispy on the outside but fluffy and buttery and toasted in the center, and the korean-inspired sauce they used was a perfect blend of spicy and savory! I felt like I got a satisfying amount of each ingredient for the price point, and I loved the fact that this sandwich wasn‚Äôt super messy! It‚Äôs incredibly rare to find a well-stuffed breakfast sandwich that doesn‚Äôt fall apart or make a mess, but they found a way to do it!
Major props to the simple and cute presentation of my to-go order, it felt cute and charming, while also being super helpful for on-the-go travel!

I absolutely loved it! I‚Äôm excited to return (especially with friends) and can easily see myself spending a morning here, or grabbing a sandwich for lunch to take to the park (which is literally just one block down the street)!

I absolutely loved it! I‚Äôm excited to return (especially with friends) and can easily see myself spending a morning here, or grabbing a sandwich for lunch to take to the park (which is literally just one block down the street)!

Very cute sandwich shop with a hip but modern atmosphere. The placement of the shop is perfect because it‚Äôs on the corner of a popular street in Bellevue and you can come here and grab a snack then head to the park across the street. The food was decent, but the sandwich started to fall apart easily. Personally there was too much sauce on mine and made the bread soggy. Smoothies were good and refreshing. The pricing was pushing it, and definitely think they should be lowered based on the quality of the sandwiches. I just don‚Äôt think you should be charging up to $30 for bread, meat, and mystery sauce lol. The employees seemed nice, but with self check out being popular you don‚Äôt really interact with people behind a register nowadays, a bit sad and less personal. Will i go back? Maybe.

This is our second time visiting this city. The first time we came, this shop had just opened, but unfortunately, I didn't have time to check it out. This time, we came specifically to try the sandwiches recommended by many foodies.  The interior design of this store was simple and natural, especially with many plants ,creating a comfortable atmosphere. However, when I was about to take a photo, a female employee behind the counter said, 'Can I help you?' I turned to look at her, and she had a frowning, unhappy expression. I really don't know what was wrong with her.

To place an order, there was a large electronic screen to select the  items. We ordered the Lox smoked salmon and Shroom  portabella mushroom sandwiches for takeout. The food was served quite quickly, and we went to a nearby park for a picnic. The mushroom and egg had a nice texture, but the sauce and bread  all had a slightly sweet taste, which I didn't particularly like. Overall, it's not worth coming here specifically to try.

About $10-13 for a small sandwich (that didn't fill me) but super delicious and fresh. My husband got a Bulgogi Sandwich and I got Shroom, both were real tasty. We also ordered an iced Tiramisu Latte which tasted like a latte with ice cream and some syrup (it was great!). I would go back, just need to get more food afterwards. Good for cafe hopping.

We also ordered an iced Tiramisu Latte which tasted like a latte with ice cream and some syrup (it was great!). I would go back, just need to get more food afterwards. Good for cafe hopping.
Good place for Korean style sandwich which is operated by Chinese, sandwich is very tasty but matcha strawberry ice is nothing like the picture shown in the menu
Good place for Korean style sandwich which is operated by Chinese, sandwich is very tasty but matcha strawberry ice is nothing like the picture shown in the menu

Ordered a spicy chicken sandwich to go. Overall it‚Äôs pretty good, love the spicy sauce, not spicy but flavorful, the egg is super soft and perfect. The only thing is I paid $12 for a sandwich but it doesn‚Äôt fulfill.

Update: We went to this spot again for breakfast and dine in this time. Staffs are friendly and the store is very cozy, clean and very instagramable! I really appreciate that they allow dogs inside. It‚Äôs an amazing dining experience here! Will recommend dining in to enjoy the food and the space if you can!

Ordered a spicy chicken sandwich to go. Overall it‚Äôs pretty good, love the spicy sauce, not spicy but flavorful, the egg is super soft and perfect. The only thing is I paid $12 for a sandwich but it doesn‚Äôt fulfill.

Update: We went to this spot again for breakfast and dine in this time. Staffs are friendly and the store is very cozy, clean and very instagramable! I really appreciate that they allow dogs inside. It‚Äôs an amazing dining experience here! Will recommend dining in to enjoy the food and the space if you can!

We felt really comfortable in the place. The design is stylish and bright, which made for a nice atmosphere.

About the drinks - the matcha latte was tasty, but the milk flavor was quite strong. Since the portion was 16 oz, it kind of felt like buying a glass of green milk. There was an option on the menu to pay +$0.50 for less ice, but we still got the usual amount of ice.

We also added mascarpone cheese on top as a paid extra, but the drink came without it. When we mentioned it, the staff quickly fixed the issue, which was appreciated. Still, having two little mix-ups with just one customer (two drinks) and not even during a busy time feels a bit off.

On a positive note, my brother ordered a drink with the LOX sandwich - the sandwich looked great and really appetizing, and he enjoyed it a lot.

I was really drawn to this place by the Google reviews, but in practice, I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll be coming back again.

Unfortunately, I didn‚Äôt take a photoüò¢

The sandwiches are interesting and taste great. I loved that they had vegetarian options, too. I'm not a vegetarian, but as a tourist, I like to have a couple of healthy meals to offset the unhealthy/heavy ones.

Ordered the tiramisu latte based on other reviews, and it did not disappoint. They can make it with decaf espresso. Very cute presentation too.

The sandwiches are interesting and taste great. I loved that they had vegetarian options, too. I'm not a vegetarian, but as a tourist, I like to have a couple of healthy meals to offset the unhealthy/heavy ones.

Ordered the tiramisu latte based on other reviews, and it did not disappoint. They can make it with decaf espresso. Very cute presentation too.

The coffee here is one of the better ones in the neighborhood. The sandwiches are pretty yummy, but every time I go, no matter what time of the day, the touch screens you order food from and the one you used to pay are filthy, like really gross. It‚Äôs always really discouraging.

The coffee here is one of the better ones in the neighborhood. The sandwiches are pretty yummy, but every time I go, no matter what time of the day, the touch screens you order food from and the one you used to pay are filthy, like really gross. It‚Äôs always really discouraging.

Super cute Korean cafe in Bellevue! I got the specialty tiramisu latte and bulgogi sandwich on a Saturday. Luckily we got there before a huge crowd came and was able to find a small table.

The latte was sweet and flavorful (which I like) though some people may find it too sweet. The bulgogi sandwich was tasty & filling. I loved the mayo topping and thought the meat‚Äôs texture was perfect, though I wished it had a bit more flavor.

In terms of ambience, the Korean aesthetic is so on point with beautiful white tile, marble tables, and so many plants! Overall nice spot to visit for lunch, though I‚Äôd avoid going during regular lunch hours if you‚Äôre in a rush. It‚Äôs a small spot and our food took a while to get to our table.

This place is cute and inviting with a bunch of plants everywhere. I ordered the mushroom sandwich, and my sister ordered the crispy chicken. Both were flavorful. My sandwich had a truffle sauce that was creamy and savory, but I wish the actual mushrooms and scrambled eggs were hot. The bread was toasted and warm but nothing else was which was kinda disappointing but atleast the flavors were good and the sandwich was filling.

My sandwich had a truffle sauce that was creamy and savory, but I wish the actual mushrooms and scrambled eggs were hot. The bread was toasted and warm but nothing else was which was kinda disappointing but atleast the flavors were good and the sandwich was filling.

Delicious Korean egg sandos!! The bread is buttery and soft. I substituted the bulgogi sauce for truffle sauce. It had a subtle truffle flavor and tasted somewhat like caesar salad dressing. The egg could be more custard-like honestly. The bulgogi was standard. A little chewy and a bit cold... but still flavorful! Overall, a decent sando and a very aesthetic cafe. They also validate parking for two hours.

tucked into an apartment building by bellevue mall, semicolon cafe is a very minimalist and aesthetic cafe to go into. there was both a self order kiosk and register manned by an employee. i ordered the pistachio bomb latte, tiramisu latte, and the bulgogi sandwich. the prices were quite reasonable for the size of everything but was quite confused by the pistachio bomb latte as there was no espresso - turns out that the pistachio bomb has espresso and not what i ordered. the staff were very nice in explaining the difference and added the shots of espresso with no charge as well as a little sign stating their differences for the self order kiosk. the drinks were a bit on the sweeter side but still good and the sandwich was delectable! would definitely come again especially when you don't have to worry about parking :)

Follow me on instagram for more reviews @angelgoffneytravels

I absolutely love when my friends find new places to eat at. I'm definitely a foodie at heart lol We came to this cafe in Bellvue. It was super aesthetically pleasing and the workers were so nice. I'm glad I don't live close by because I'd never lose any weight lol

Our menu:
*HAM
*Strawberry Bingsoo

*BELT (x2)
*Tiramisu Latte

The breakfast sandwich was so delicious. The toast was nice and buttery, the eggs were fluffy and the meat was perfect. I switched & got the BELT sauce on my HAM sandwich and it was amazing. It was my first time trying bingsoo and wow. It wasn't too sweet (which I loved) & there also was some delicious cheesecake bites and fresh strawberries in it. If you're ever in the area it's definitely worth the stop.

I won't go back because service is quite bad. I don't expect people to be chirpy but don't take out your negativity on me .

Also this place likes to nickel and dime...charges more money for less ice and no ice.

Very limited seating, and it gets cold.  Best to sit behind the "menu" wall.

Sandwiches can't be order at the "tablet", have to do it with the cashier. The food was better than the drink .

We stopped at Semicolon Cafe in Bellevue for a quick and tasty lunch on a short 2 night getaway that we made to the Seattle/Bellevue area.They serve some really tasty Korean Egg Drop sandwiches as well as a variety of refreshing drinks, macarons, pudding, and bingsoo. Korean Egg Drop sandwiches consist of thick slices of Brioche bread stuffed with fluffy scrambled eggs and a variety of other fillings. (I couldn't actually find the words Egg Drop Sandwich anywhere on their menu or their website, but they serve Bingsoo which is a Korean dessert and their sandwiches match all the pictures and descriptions of Egg Drop Sandwiches that pop up if I search for "Egg Drop Sandwiches" on Google. So, I'm very sure that's what they're serving!)

There's a rectangular screen set up where you can place your order electronically. We ordered:

Brewed Coffee
Caramel Latte
Lady Matcha
Chicken Sandwich
Avocado Sandwich

Our first time eating Korean Egg Drop sandwiches and this was a marvelous introduction to it. Usually our picky eater isn't a fan of egg. Faced with these sandwiches she was a bit apprehensive at first. After eating these sandwiches though, she loved them so much that she asked if we could eat there again on the way home!

Their drinks were wonderful as well, and it's got a very aesthetic feel to it. Highly recommend this place!

Service: Good
Parking: 2 hour parking available if you download the LAZ parking app and use Semicolon Cafe's promo code
Location: 10451 NE 2nd St., Bellevue, WA

Semicolon is cute little cafe in downtown Bellevue serving Korean egg sandwiches, drinks, and pastries. The interior is small with limited seating but is nicely decorated with lush greenery. When we arrived around noon, the restaurant was quite busy with no seating available. We ordered via the kiosk and had the option to customize our order (ex. change sauces). After about 15 mins, we got our food - an avocado sandwich for myself and a mushroom sandwich for my friend. I enjoyed my food - the avocado was creamy, the egg was cooked well and I especially liked the brioche bread and its buttery and light taste. The only drawback is the cost - $10 for a simple sandwich seems a little pricey to me.

I got the bulgogi sandwich and the tiramisu latte. I seriously LOVE the sandwich, it has many different ingredients inside so if you are a texture person like me you would love it! The tiramisu latte is good but nothing too special, it‚Äôs refreshing though for a nice lunch. Gotta say though it is pretty expensive.

Super cute little spot in downtown Bellevue. The servers were super nice and the bingsoo was really good, too! But the sandwiches left a little to be wanted. Needs more flavor, more punch!

Place was super cute, loved all the plants. Sandwiches were good and different to what we are used too eating which I love! We ordered the lox and bulgogi sandwich also a tiramisu latte and strawberry banana smoothie, everything was good. Make sure to get there before 9:30-10am, we went around 9am and was almost empty but started getting busy right after. The only thing I was a little disappointing was the service. You don‚Äôt get greeted or asked what you would like to order when you walk up to the counter. Even though I wasn‚Äôt happy with that they did on the other hand have quick service, food was prepared very quick. Apart from that I would return again and think anyone in the area should give it a try.

Very cute coffee shop in Bellevue over by the Safeway. I found it by chance and decided to give it a shot after I saw a TikTok video showing their menu.

They have a kiosk that you order off of and a small menu off to the side showing pictures and ingredients of what everything is. My husband and I got their sandwiches and a pink matcha lady. All of it was incredibly fresh and had amazing flavor. The shop was clean and had a cute little window table that felt private and quiet (if anyone is looking to sit and get some work done in a cute cafe).

Tried Mango and Matcha bingsoo - they are okay not too sweet but I expect the mango to be more ripe. You can park at the garage (entrance next to the store) but will need to use the promo code (which you get from the store) when you pay your parking through LAZ parking app - the promo code is for 2 hours free parking.

Very tiny and cute sandwich and coffee shop . Limited seating capacity . They can validate 2 hour parking code with a promo code . Self service coffee shop . Service is quite quick . Limited menu but very exciting sandwich options and fruit drink choices . Seating is little uncomfortable for as it is wooden chairs . Avacado Sandwich is too good . Very berry drink is also good . Prices are very reasonable.

Belt sandwich is so delicious! Good music and chill vibes.
Belt sandwich is so delicious! Good music and chill vibes.

Semicolon is a lovely cafe in Downtown Bellevue, bright and modern. It has wall windows, stylish tables and stools, lively houseplants above an Asian style curtain door for the kitchen behind the counter. I got there on a weekday morning shortly after they open, so I was the only one there.

My latte was good, and my jaw dropped when I got the breakfast sandwich. It's a thing of beauty, almost too pretty to be consumed. When I did make up my mind to "destroy" the beauty and taste it, I didn't regret at all. The bulgogi beef is well marinated and flavorful, the veggie is fresh and the special sauce is creamy. It was the best breakfast sandwich I had in a long time.

I returned a few days later with high expectations, only to get a little disappointed this time. The Tiramisu Latte didn't stand out and the bacon breakfast sandwich wasn't as gorgeous as the one I'd been craving in my head over and over even since that first visit. I went back yet another time on a Sunday and the cafe was packed with an "Instagram crowd"‚Äìif you know what I mean. The whole vibe was quite different from the way I liked it, so I left without getting anything.

I still fancy Semicolon's breakfast sandwich, and I'd love to get another latte from Adam, the barista from my first visit. But I have more realistic expectations now, and for sure I'll avoid lunch time especially on a weekend.

super fun place - just what you‚Äôd expect. I got a sandwich (avocado) and the an iced tiramisu latte with coconut milk. The bread for the sandwich was good and the latte was super creative.

Service was just a touch pad but the food came quick.

Would try a different place before coming back but i would recommend it to anyone in the area! :)

To find parking is a nightmare! It took me 15 min to find one. Also, I have never experienced at a caf√© such a bad costumer service. How can this place ask for a tip if there is no interaction at all with anyone up front? I don‚Äôt understand. They could at least greet the costumers I did leave tip anyhow. One of the sandwiches was good, the other one was mediocre, I could barely eat it so I bought another one thinking a third option would turn out better. It was NOT the case and I was so disappointed to have spent $50 dollars on 3 small sandwiches and 2 drinks. Never coming back here again. I do think the presentation of the food is great, but not worth it.
